III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
1

(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date, a staff member was making sexually
derogatory statements to a youth in front of other youth
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via phone on 4/8/2025.
Complainant did not have any further information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/9/25
along with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A reported Staff 1 said Youth
A’s brother raped Youth A and that is why Youth A is in foster
care. Youth A reported Staff 1 said this to him in front of Youth B,
Youth C, and Youth D. Youth A denied telling Staff 1 his brother
sexually assaulted him and denied knowing how Staff 1 would
know. Youth A reported he did not tell anyone at the facility about
anything that occurred with his brother. Youth A reported Staff 1
said this one day while upstairs eating lunch, sometime before 12
o’clock. Youth A did not remember how long ago this occurred.
Youth A reported a female staff was nearby and could not recall
her name or what she looked like. Youth A reported Staff 1 made
the comment after Youth A was in a fight with Youth C on the
basketball court involving Youth C throwing basketballs at Youth A
and the two youth slapping one another. Youth A reported he
called Youth C the “N” word and the slapping started.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/9/25 along
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 denied making derogatory
statements to any youth at the facility and denied saying Youth A
was raped by his brother. Staff 1 denied having any knowledge of
why Youth A was in foster care or having been sexually abused by
his brother. Staff 1 reported staff do not have the information on
why youth enter foster care or their background information. Staff
1 reported recalling an incident in the second floor lounge when
Youth A and Youth C were slapping one another around lunch
time. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth C frequently get into
arguments when Youth A will say the “N” word to Youth C. Staff 1
denied hearing any other staff make any derogatory remarks
towards Youth A or any other youth.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/9/25
along with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B reported he likes Staff 1,
describing him as a respectful staff and denying having any
concerns with him. Youth B denied hearing Staff 1 make any
inappropriate comments about Youth A, even as a joke. Youth B
2

denied hearing Staff 1 say anything about Youth B’s family or
brother or anything that may have happened to Youth A. Youth B
reported Staff 1 has to redirect Youth A as he gets into fights with
other youth because Youth A says mean things to them. Youth B
reported Youth A and Youth C are the same age and get into
fights with each other often and when they start to argue, staff
redirect and separate them.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/9/25
along with MDHHS Specialist. Youth C denied hearing any staff,
including Staff 1, say anything bad to Youth A. Youth C reported
Staff 1 is a great staff who helps keep the youth safe. Youth C
reported he heard other youth say Youth A’s brother is “gay” and
“sucked Youth A’s dick.” Youth C reported Youth A’s brother used
to be placed at the facility. Youth C reported not knowing how
other youth heard Youth A’s brother is gay and that he was placed
at the facility.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/9/25
along with MDHHS Specialist. Youth D reported Staff 1 is a nice
staff and denied having issues with him. Youth D denied hearing
Staff 1 say anything at any time about Youth A or his brother, or
anything that might have happened before he came to the facility.
Youth D reported Youth A starts fights often and says bad words
like the “N” word a lot. Youth D reported staff instruct Youth A to
stop using bad words. Youth D admitted to telling Youth A his
brother is gay because Youth D was mad at Youth A. Youth D
denied knowing if Youth A’s brother is gay or not. Youth D
reported other youth at the facility said things about Youth A’s
brother. Youth D did not recall who said things about Youth A’s
brother. Youth D reported he asked staff about Youth A’s brother,
and they told him Youth A’s brother was very bad. Youth D did not
remember which staff said this.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/9/25 along
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 is great with the
youth and denied having concerns with him. Staff 2 denied
hearing or knowing about Staff 1 saying anything inappropriate,
including Youth A’s brother raped him, to anyone at any time. Staff
2 reported only supervisors receive the background information
about the trauma youth have been through and staff working with
youth do not get that information unless a youth tells them on their
own. Staff 2 reported when Youth A was escalated another youth
(couldn’t remember who) said to Youth A “that is why you got
raped by your brother and your momma don’t love you”. Staff 2
reported at this time she separated Youth A from the area. Staff 2
reported she has heard Youth A telling other youth about his
brother and about his brother sexually assaulting him. Staff 2
3

denied having any knowledge of any youth’s past trauma or
reasoning for entering care or the facility unless youth volunteer
this information themselves. Staff 2 denied Staff 1 or any staff
having conversations of any kind about any youth’s past trauma
including Youth A possibly being sexually assaulted or his reason
for entering foster care.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/7/25 along
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 is a good staff,
and she does not have any concerns with how he speaks to
youth. Staff 3 reported staff only know about a youth’s background
and past trauma if youth choose to disclose it to them on their
own. Staff 3 reported if there are potential triggers, a safety plan
may be put into place, but the details of any past trauma are not
included in the information given to staff. Staff 3 denied hearing or
having knowledge of Staff 1 saying anything to Youth A or anyone
else about Youth A’s past or Youth A's brother having sexually
assaulted him. Staff 3 reported she has heard Youth A disclose to
other youth and staff his brother molested him and his mother
drinks every day.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/7/25 along
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 is great with the
youth at the facility, and he has no concerns regarding how he
speaks with youth. Staff 4 denied hearing Staff 1 say anything
inappropriate about or to Youth A regarding his past or his brother
including that his brother sexually assaulted him. Staff 4 reported
he vaguely recalled an incident in which Youth A and Youth C
were slapping one another after arguing on the basketball court
and denied Staff 1 was present for this. Staff 4 denied having
knowledge of youths’ histories or things that may have happened
to them. Staff 4 reported they are not given background
information on youth unless a youth talks about it to them.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/7/25 along
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 5 reported Staff 1 is a great staff and
denied ever witnessing him be or say anything inappropriate to
any youth. Staff 5 denied having heard anything about why Youth
A is in care or any trauma he may have experienced prior to
coming to the facility. Staff 5 denied hearing Staff 1 ever say
anything to Youth A about his brother doing anything to him. Staff
5 reported she was present for the incident between Youth A and
Youth C on the basketball court which led to them slapping each
other and denied Staff 1 being present that day.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/7/25
along with MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor reported Staff 1 is a
good staff and the kids like him. Supervisor reported staff only
4

know about a youth’s past if the youth decides to share it with
them. Supervisor denied hearing any staff or youth talk about what
happened to Youth A prior to coming to the facility. Supervisor
denied hearing Staff 1 said anything about Youth A’s brother
doing something to Youth A at any time. Supervisor reported
Youth A disclosed to her he had been hurt at home but did not
provide any details.
Staff 6 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/9/25 along
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 6 reported he hasn’t worked with
Staff 1 often, but he has no concerns regarding Staff 1. Staff 6
denied hearing Staff 1 say anything inappropriate, including about
Youth A’s brother sexually assaulted him or why Youth A is in
care. Staff 6 denied having knowledge of Youth A’s past trauma.
Staff 6 reported if staff are given any information about youths’
histories, it is to avoid triggers or to safety plan, but it is not
specific. Staff 6 denied having been in a situation in which he and
Staff 1 were present for an incident between Youth A and Youth
C.
Documentation review:
• Staff 1 has an Employee Counseling Form dated
10/11/2024 (written warning and 3 day suspension) in his
employee file for an incident unrelated to this investigation.
Managerial Training Form for Staff 1 dated 9/13/2024
documents receipt of discussion on 1:1 assignments and
states if polices are not followed disciplinary action may be
taken.
• Incident Report dated 4/7/2025 documents an altercation
between Youth A and Youth C in which Youth C slapped
Youth A following them arguing on the basketball court.
The incident report does not list Staff 1 as being present.
• Employee Handbook, Behavior Policies, Item C, Prohibited
Client Interventions states employees of the facility are
prohibited from using verbal abuse, ridicule, humiliation or
threats.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance. All staff and youth interviewed
(besides Youth A) denied Staff 1 ever stated Youth A was sexually
assaulted by his brother or why Youth A is in foster care to anyone
at any time. It is further supported through the incident report
regarding the altercation Youth A identified during his interview.
Staff 1 was not listed as being present for the incident Youth A
mentioned. Staff 4 and Staff 5 denied recollection of Staff 1 being
present during or after the incident. It is further supported by
5

statements made in interviews confirming Youth A openly shares
details with other youth and staff at the facility about his brother
and his past on his own accord.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
